at.nineyards.anyline.camera

Class AnylineView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • at.nineyards.anyline.camera.CameraView
          • at.nineyards.anyline.camera.AnylineBaseView
            • at.nineyards.anyline.camera.AnylineView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnylineBaseModuleView

    public class AnylineView
extends AnylineBaseView

    A view that combines the CameraView and the CutoutView that can be configured via xml.

    This view can be configured using an AnylineViewConfig. A "cutout" can be defined where the object to scan should be placed. This cutout can be visualized in different ways. This view keeps the cutout that is visualized and the area that is cropped out of the image in sync.

    Example: 

    
        <at.nineyards.anyline.modules.energy.AnylineView
            android:id="@+id/energy_scan_view"
            android:layout_width="match_parent"
            android:layout_height="match_parent"
            app:preferred_preview_width="720"
            app:preferred_preview_height="1280"
            app:preferred_picture_width="1080"
            app:preferred_picture_height="1920"
            app:cutout_alignment="top"
            app:cutout_style="rect"
            app:cutout_outside_color="#55000000"
            app:cutout_offset_x="0"
            app:cutout_offset_y="160"
            app:cutout_crop_padding_x="0"
            app:cutout_crop_padding_y="0"
            app:cutout_crop_offset_x="0"
            app:cutout_crop_offset_y="0"
            app:cutout_width="540"
            app:cutout_max_width_percent="90"
            app:cutout_max_height_percent="90"
            app:cutout_ratio_from_size_width="540"
            app:cutout_ratio_from_size_height="98"
            app:cutout_rect_corner_radius_in_dp="4"
            app:cutout_stroke_width_in_dp="2"
            app:cutout_stroke_color="#FFFFFF"
            app:flash_mode="manual"
            app:flash_alignment="bottom_right"
            app:flash_image_on="@drawable/flash_icon"
            app:flash_image_off="@drawable/flash_icon_off"
            app:flash_image_auto="@drawable/flash_icon_auto"
            />

    This extends the AnylineBaseView only by the possibility to configure it via XML. If that is not used you may use the AnylineBaseView.

    See Also:
    AnylineBaseView
